programs.name: Startup SG Founder
programs.description: Provides mentorship and startup capital grant of S$50,000 to first-time entrepreneurs with innovative business ideas. Startups are required to commit S$10,000 as co-matching fund to the grant.

programs.name: Startup SG Tech
programs.description: Supports Proof-of-Concept (POC) and Proof-of-Value (POV) for commercialisation of innovative technologies.

programs.name: Adopt Technology to Digitise My Business
Operation & Technology Roadmap (OTR)
programs.description: Development of technology roadmaps to map out priorities aligned with businesses’ strategies and developmental plans. Eligible SMEs may receive up to 70% funding support.

programs.name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
programs.description: Supports businesses in the adoption of productivity solutions. Businesses can choose from a list of pre-scoped solutions and receive up to 50% funding support for eligible costs.

programs.name: Start Digital
programs.description: SMEs new to using digital technology can adopt any 2 solutions e.g. Digital Marketing, Digital Collaboration, Accounting, HR/Payroll, Cybersecurity, etc., at no cost for at least 6 months (min. 18 months contract).

programs.name: Technology for Enterprise Capability Upgrading (T-Up)
programs.description: Get access to talents from A*STAR’s Research Institutes and build in-house R&D capabilities.

programs.name: Career Trial
programs.description: Allows companies to assess jobseekers’ job fit through a short-term trial, before formal employment. Government will provide training allowance to the jobseekers for the trial period (up to 3 months).

programs.name: Jobs Growth Incentive (JGI)
programs.description: The Jobs Growth Incentive (JGI) was announced on 17 Aug 2020 to encourage employers to accelerate their hiring of local workforce by providing wage support, so as to create good and long-term jobs for locals.

programs.name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
programs.description: The PSG supports businesses in the adoption of productivity solutions. Businesses can choose from a list of pre-scoped solutions and receive up to 50% funding support for eligible costs.

programs.name: Senior Employment Credit
programs.description: No application is required. The Senior Employment Credit provides wage offsets to help employers that employ workers aged 55 and above adjust to the higher Retirement Age and Re-employment Age.

programs.name: SkillsFuture Work-Study Programmes (WSPs)
programs.description: Businesses can groom and hire fresh talent through Work-Study Programmes across Certificate, Diploma, Post-Diploma, and Degree levels. Businesses will jointly design and deliver with Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs) and appointed private providers.

programs.name: Start Digital
programs.description: SMEs new to using digital technology can adopt any 2 solutions e.g. Digital Marketing, Digital Collaboration, Accounting, HR/Payroll, Cybersecurity, etc., at no cost for at least 6 months (min. 18 months contract).

programs.name: Wage Credit Scheme
programs.description: No application is required. The government provides co-funding of wage increments for Singaporean employees earning a gross monthly wage of up to $5,000.

programs.name: e-Adviser for Skills Training
programs.description: For business owners to get personalised recommendations on skills training courses and SkillsFuture initiatives relevant to your business as part of the SkillsFuture Movement.

programs.name: SkillsFuture for Enterprise User Guide
programs.description: Check out the 5 key steps to get started on your SkillsFuture journey

programs.name: Career Trial
programs.description: Allows companies to assess jobseekers’ job fit through a short-term trial, before formal employment. Government will provide training allowance to the jobseekers for the trial period (up to 3 months).

programs.name: Citrep+
programs.description: Build ICT technical skills for your employees in areas such as cyber security, data analytics, network and infrastructure and software development. Funding support of up to 90%.

programs.name: Company-Led Training (CLT) Programme
programs.description: CLT accelerates professional development through on-the-job training programme for fresh to mid-level professionals acquiring competencies for jobs in demand by industry, especially the Digital Economy sector.

programs.name: Employment Support for Ex-Offenders
programs.description: This programme supports companies to tap on ex-offenders as an alternative pool of trained and skilled workers.

programs.name: Employment Support for Persons with Disabilities
programs.description: Hire, train and integrate Persons with Disabilities into the workforce. Receive course fee subsidies of up to 90% for SG Enable’s list of curated training courses.

programs.name: Enabling Employment Credit
programs.description: The Enabling Employment Credit provides wage offsets to employers hiring persons with disabilities.

programs.name: Enhanced Training Support for SMEs (ETSS)
programs.description: The ETSS offers higher course fee grant of up to 90% of the course fees and absentee payroll funding of 80% of basic hourly salary at a higher cap of $7.50 per hour for SMEs signing up for SSG-supported courses. With effect from 1 Jan 2022, SSG will introduce a fixed absentee payroll rate of $4.50 per hour, capped at $100,000 per organisation annually.

programs.name: Jobs Growth Incentive (JGI)
programs.description: The Jobs Growth Incentive (JGI) was announced on 17 Aug 2020 to encourage employers to accelerate their hiring of local workforce by providing wage support, so as to create good and long-term jobs for locals.

programs.name: Part-Time Re-employment Grant (PTRG)
programs.description: Provides funding support to companies that voluntarily commit to providing part-time re-employment to all eligible seniors who request for it.

programs.name: SkillsFuture Work-Study Programmes (WSPs)
programs.description: Businesses can groom and hire fresh talent through Work-Study Programmes across Certificate, Diploma, Post-Diploma, and Degree levels. Businesses will jointly design and deliver with Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs) and appointed private providers.

programs.name: Uplifting Employment Credit
programs.description: The Uplifting Employment Credit provides wage offsets to employers hiring ex-offenders.

programs.name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
programs.description: Supports businesses in the adoption of productivity solutions. Businesses can choose from a list of pre-scoped solutions and receive up to 50% funding support for eligible costs.

programs.name: Progressive Wage Credit Scheme
programs.description: Provides transitional support to employers for Progressive Wages moves, by co-funding wage increases of lower-wage workers between 2022 and 2026.

programs.name: Startup SG Founder
programs.description: Provides mentorship and startup capital grant of S$50,000 to first-time entrepreneurs with innovative business ideas. Startups are required to commit S$10,000 as co-matching fund to the grant.

programs.name: 3R Fund
programs.description: Supports companies and organisations registered in Singapore to implement waste minimisation and recycling projects to reduce solid waste sent for disposal.

programs.name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
programs.description: Supports businesses in the adoption of productivity solutions. Businesses can choose from a list of pre-scoped solutions and receive up to 50% funding support for eligible costs.

programs.name: Water Efficiency Fund (WEF)
programs.description: Provides funding to local non-domestic water users to enable them to improve water efficiency through water efficiency assessment, pilot study, recycling, adoption of water efficient equipment & industrial water solution demonstration projects.

programs.name: Part-Time Re-employment Grant (PTRG)
programs.description: Provides funding support to companies that voluntarily commit to providing part-time re-employment to all eligible seniors who request for it.

programs.name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
programs.description: Supports businesses in the adoption of productivity solutions. Businesses can choose from a list of pre-scoped solutions and receive up to 50% funding support for eligible costs.

programs.name: Enhanced Enterprise Financing Scheme - SME Working Capital Loan
programs.description: Enhanced Enterprise Financing Scheme - SME Working Capital Loan Receive greater financing support to bridge your working capital gaps. Maximum supported loan of $500,000.

programs.name: Enhanced Enterprise Financing Scheme - Trade Loan
programs.description: Get better access to trade financing amidst the current environment of slower business activities and longer payment cycles. Maximum supported loan of $10m, with 90% Government risk-share.

programs.name: Enhanced Enterprise Financing Scheme - Trade Loan
programs.description: Extension of enhanced support for trade financing needs from 1 April 2022 to 30 September 2022, to ease enterprises’ access to credit to mitigate short-term cashflow pressures. Enhanced support for enterprises trading in challenged markets to encourage internationalisation.

programs.name: Enterprise Financing Scheme (EFS)
programs.description: The EFS helps Singapore enterprises to access financing more readily. EnterpriseSG will share the loan default risk in the event of enterprise insolvency with the Participating Financial Institutions.

programs.name: Double Tax Deduction for Internationalisation (DTDi)
programs.description: Companies planning to expand overseas can benefit from the DTDi, with a 200% tax deduction on eligible expenses for international market expansion and investment development activities.

programs.name: Hand-Carried Exports Scheme (HCES)
programs.description: HCES is applicable if you wish to zero-rate your supplies to overseas customers for goods hand-carried out of Singapore via Changi International Airport.

programs.name: Major Exporters’ Scheme (MES)
programs.description: Under MES, GST on non-dutiable goods is suspended at the point of import and also when the goods are removed from Zero GST warehouses.

programs.name: Conduct R&D or to develop/test new products and services
Enterprise Innovation Scheme
programs.description: Enhanced deductions for R&D, innovation and capability development activities, with the option to partially convert to a cash payout in lieu of tax deductions.

programs.name: Develop My Brand and Improve Brand Awareness
Double Tax Deduction for Internationalisation (DTDi)
programs.description: Companies planning to expand overseas can benefit from the DTDi, with a 200% tax deduction on eligible expenses for international market expansion and investment development activities.

programs.name: Major Exporters’ Scheme (MES)
programs.description: Under MES, GST on non-dutiable goods is suspended at the point of import and also when the goods are removed from Zero GST warehouses.

programs.name: Corporate Volunteer Scheme (CVS)
programs.description: Under the CVS, businesses enjoy 250% tax deduction on wages and qualifying expenses when their staff volunteer or provide services to IPCs, including through secondments. Qualifying expenditure is subject to a cap of $250,000 per business per YA, and a cap of $100,000 per IPC per CY. The CVS (previously known as Business and IPC Partnership Scheme) was extended by three years to end-2026.

programs.name: A*STAR Collaborative Commercialization Marketplace (ACCM)
programs.description: ACCM is a platform that connects companies with A*STAR’s technologies and capabilities to co-develop and commercialise innovative solutions.

programs.name: Chief Technology Officer-as-a-Service (CTOaaS)
programs.description: CTOaaS supports SMEs to self-help to access digital solutions, digital consultancy services and other resources, via a consolidated web-based touchpoint.

programs.name: Digital Leaders Programme
programs.description: The Digital Leaders Programme enables promising, high-potential local companies to become digital leaders by equipping them with digital capabilities and talent to transform their business models and capture new growth opportunities. More details in due course.

programs.name: Nationwide E-invoicing Initiative (InvoiceNow)
programs.description: The nationwide E-invoicing network (InvoiceNow) helps businesses improve efficiency, reduce cost, enjoy faster payment and stay green. Interested businesses can choose from over 100 InvoiceNow solutions.

programs.name: Peppol-Ready Accounting/ERP Solution Providers
programs.description: Peppol Ready Solutions are solutions such as Accounting (AR and/or AP), ERP and SCM which are connected to the Peppol network where business users can send and receive e-invoices through the Peppol network.

programs.name: SkillsFuture for Digital Workplace
programs.description: Equip your staff the right mindset and skills to welcome emerging technologies and technological changes to the workplace, and to take advantage of new opportunities in the future economy.

programs.name: SkillsFuture Series “Tech-enabled Services”
programs.description: This is a catalogue of SSG-supported courses on Tech-Enabled Services.

programs.name: SME Digital Tech Hub
programs.description: The SME Digital Tech Hub is a dedicated hub that provides specialist digital technology advisory to SMEs with more advanced digital needs, such as data analytics and cybersecurity.

programs.name: Wireless@Sg (Wireless@Sg for Business)
programs.description: Businesses and venue owners who want to provide free Wi-Fi to their patrons are encouraged to partner operators to extend Wireless@SG service within their premises on commercial arrangements.

programs.name: A*STAR Collaborative Commercialization Marketplace (ACCM)
programs.description: With more than 2000 companies onboard, companies can connect and advance common interests within and beyond their respective industry and markets.

programs.name: APEC Cross Border Privacy Rules (CBPR) System
programs.description: Businesses are to implement data privacy policies consistent with the APEC Privacy Framework, bridging different national privacy laws within the APEC region, reducing barriers to information flow for global trade.

programs.name: Conduct R&D or to develop/test new products and services
A*STAR Collaborative Commercialization Marketplace (ACCM)
programs.description: With more than 2000 companies onboard, companies can connect and advance common interests within and beyond their respective industry and markets.

programs.name: Open Innovation Platform (OIP)
programs.description: The Open Innovation Platform match user companies in getting quality and multi-disciplinary solutions to meet their digital innovation and business needs; enhanced with new features to increase scale and speed.

programs.name: Develop My Brand and Improve Brand Awareness
Marketing Toolkit
programs.description: Self-help tool to improve your company’s value proposition and learn how you can develop marketing strategies to drive competitiveness and sales.

programs.name: Digital Solutions Directory - Bill and Pay Online
programs.description: Adopt Bill and Pay Online solutions to execute transactions remotely e.g. electronic invoicing and digital payments. Listed solutions are either free, subsidised, or PSG-supported.

programs.name: Digital Solutions Directory - Remote Working
programs.description: Adopt remote working solutions such as online collaboration, virtual meetings and e-signatures. Listed solutions are either free, subsidised, or PSG-supported.

programs.name: Digital Solutions Directory - Visitor Management
programs.description: Adopt visitor management solutions e.g. contact tracking, temperature screening, crowd management and queue management. Listed solutions are either free, subsidised, or PSG-supported.

programs.name: Digital Solutions Directory - Workforce Management
programs.description: Adopt workforce management solutions for staff scheduling, manpower resource allocation, staggered working hours, etc. Listed solutions are either free, subsidised, or PSG-supported.

programs.name: National Centre of Excellence for Workplace Learning (NACE)
programs.description: The NACE equips companies with the capability to develop best-in-class training practices to enhance learning at the workplace.

programs.name: Professional Conversion Programme (PCP)
programs.description: Receive training and salary support to hire and reskill job seekers, including mid-career switchers. Receive up to 90% salary support capped at $6,000/month for every eligible new hire.

programs.name: SGUnited Jobs Initiative
programs.description: Participate in the SGUnited Jobs Initiative by adding the hashtag #SGUnitedJobs after the job title when posting jobs on MyCareersFuture.sg

programs.name: SGUnited Mid-Career Pathways Programme
programs.description: Host organisations can take on mid-career individuals who bring with them a wealth of work experience on attachments. Upon completion of the attachment, host organisations may consider hiring well-performing individuals as permanent employees when business conditions improve and when they have greater confidence to hire.

programs.name: Skills Framework
programs.description: The Skills Frameworks provide useful information on job roles, key tasks expected to be performed by each job role, as well as the skills that an individual should possess for each job role.

programs.name: SkillsFuture for Digital Workplace
programs.description: Equip your staff the right mindset and skills to welcome emerging technologies and technological changes to the workplace, and to take advantage of new opportunities in the future economy.

programs.name: SkillsFuture Series “Tech-enabled Services”
programs.description: This is a catalogue of SSG-supported courses on Tech-Enabled Services.

programs.name: Total WSH A-I-ME Programme
programs.description: Total WSH is a holistic and integrated approach to manage the interactions between work, safety and health, so as to promote the wellbeing of workers and employers.
